Expectation1: Respond to emails and messages within a reasonable time frame
Situation1: The team awaits a clarification before progressing with a shared task.
Expectation2: Engage in spiritual study and reflection
Situation2: The nun has a quiet afternoon and plans to spend time in personal spiritual reading and contemplation.
Story: I sat at my small desk in the convent, sunlight streaming through the window, my Bible open before me. The quiet of the afternoon was a rare gift, and I had been looking forward to this time of spiritual reading and reflection all week. Just as I closed my eyes to pray, my phone buzzed insistently. A string of messages from my colleagues flashed on the screen—questions about a project, requests for clarification. The team was waiting for my input before they could move forward. I knew the expectation: respond promptly, be a reliable part of the group. But the silence around me felt sacred, and I longed to honor my commitment to spiritual study, to be present with God in these precious moments. My heart tugged in two directions—toward duty and toward devotion. I stared at the phone, feeling the weight of both worlds pressing in, uncertain which call to answer first.
